summary_md: This round formalized several structural lemmas and constructive algorithms for the hunters–rabbit evasion number. Key verified tools: the R-recurrence R_{i+1}=N(R_i)\S_{i+1} (schedule verification); the permanent-blockers lemma h(G) ≤ |U|+h(G−U); and the disjoint-union and separator-composition bounds. Constructive results: an explicit 1‑hunter forward/backward sweep proves h(P_n)=1 and yields the classification h(G)=1 iff G is a forest (leaf double‑shot induction). Using an anchor plus the path sweep we proved h(C_n)=2 for all n and hence h=2 for unicyclic graphs. Algorithmic consequences: h(G) ≤ fvs(G)+1 (block feedback vertices) gives an n^{O(k)} YES-recognizer on graphs with fvs≤k−1; periodic-lift verification and the pathwidth bound h(G) ≤ pw(G)+1 were also established. Cautions: the Z-process Z_i is not monotone and minor‑monotonicity of {h≤k} is unsettled; cacti tightness remains open. Citations: proofs.md; research_notes.
one_line_summary: k=1 classified; permanent blockers, cycles/unicyclic h=2; FVS/pw reductions
highlights: Permanent blockers: h(G) ≤ |U| + h(G−U) (use anchors/blockers to reduce to subgraphs).
Disjoint-union & separator composition: h(G⊔H)=max{h(G),h(H)} and h(G) ≤ |S| + max_i h(piece_i).
Paths & k=1: explicit 1‑hunter 2n−3 sweep gives h(P_n)=1.
k=1 classification: h(G)=1 iff G is a forest (inductive leaf double‑shot proof).
Cycles & unicyclic graphs: h(C_n)=2 via anchoring one vertex; any unicyclic graph has h=2.
Algorithmic bounds: h(G) ≤ fvs(G)+1 (⇒ n^{O(k)} YES on fvs≤k−1) and h(G) ≤ pw(G)+1; periodic schedules verifiable by acyclicity of the time‑lift.
next_questions: Design and formalize a separator‑based DP (treewidth/FVS) to decide h(G)≤k in n^{O(k)} time or else prove hardness for small k (e.g. k=2).
Implement the small‑FVS recognizer and a block–cut DP; test on cacti/necklaces to resolve whether all cacti have h=2 or require h=3.
Empirically test the conjectured equality h(G)=degeneracy(G) on all graphs up to n≤10 and on small trees to find counterexamples or supporting data.
